intro: Erythranthe barbata, commonly known as the hairy throatplant, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its unique floral structure and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and native plant collections.
